prompt: <description>Part 1: Creating a Rectangular Prism with a Cylindrical Hole Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.375, 0.0] Step 2: Draw the 2D Sketch for the Rectangular Prism Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system. Face 1 1. Draw a line from point (0.0, 0.0) to point (0.75, 0.0) (line 1) 2. Draw a line from point (0.75, 0.0) to point (0.75, 0.25) (line 2) 3. Draw a line from point (0.75, 0.25) to point (0.5, 0.25) (line 3) 4. Draw a line from point (0.5, 0.25) to point (0.5, 0.5) (line 4) 5. Draw a line from point (0.5, 0.5) to point (0.0, 0.5) (line 5) 6. Draw a line from point (0.0, 0.5) to point (0.0, 0.0) (line 6) Step 3: Scale the Sketch Scale the entire sketch with a factor of 0.75. Step 4: Extrude the Sketch to Create the Rectangular Prism Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis with an extrusion depth of 0.375 units. Step 5: Create the Cylindrical Hole within the Rectangular Prism 1. In the same sketch, create a circle with a center point at (0.25, 0.25) and a radius of 0.125 units 2. Create an arc using the endpoints (0.125, 0.375) and (0.375, 0.375) while having the center point at (0.25, 0.375) 3. Connect the free endpoints of the arc and the circle to close the loop for the cylindrical hole. 4. Scale and position the circular sketch to fit the hole dimensions of the original rectangular prism. 5. Extrude the newly created sketch along the Z-axis with a negative depth (towards the bottom) and an extrusion depth matching the height of the rectangular prism. Intermediate Result The intermediate result is a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The dimensions are as follows: - Height: 0.75 units - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.375 units</description>

</json>
